title: wtf is this cull garbage?
body:
Compare this to Dorans Blade

besides the on hit heal, every stat is weaker: no HP, 3 less AD. Dorans Blade can be kept later because the lifesteal scales with damage and it gives better stats than component items like longsword.

Now the real benefit seems to be the 300 gold... Still worth!
but wait! Cull, unlike avarice blade, **doesn't build into anything.** So when you sell it, you lose 290 gold. 

So around 20 mins in game where you already have ~4000 gold, you gain extra 10 gold in exchange for significantly weaker early game stats. 

this item might as well not exist

replies.body: Cull is for when you know you shouldn't really be trying to win lane and just play safe and farm it provides 400 gold with it's passive and an extra 180 when sold it returns more than doran blade but doran blade is for when you want to farm champions

> [{quoted}](name=EcchiOtakuTM,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=VkMtZr0E,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2015-11-17T03:08:03.500+0000)
>
> Cull is for when you know you shouldn't really be trying to win lane and just play safe and farm it provides 400 gold with it's passive and an extra 180 when sold it returns more than doran blade but doran blade is for when you want to farm champions

Actually, I think Cull is best on champs like Caitlyn, who have a strong early, where the enemy would normally be okay if it's just a farm fest. Cull says "if you just turn this into a farm fest, I'm going to reach my power spikes before you do."
The point is to passively farm with it. AD to help last hitting, sustain to stay in lane and an obvious gold passive.

The item makes a profit of 400g total since its 1g per cs and an additional 300

It's sustain is more efficient than D blade early and is made to be sold as soon as you get the 100 cs mark

It's especially good on ADs like Lucian who have double hit abilities
Yeah, but still it is kinda slow and now you don't even get into the late game.
You only lose 50 gold, which is more than made up from the sellback gold
Yes... ok.. so isn't it better to just buy another item that can be built into something?

> [{quoted}](name=Cherysse,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=VkMtZr0E,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2015-11-17T02:59:04.013+0000)
>
> Yes... ok.. so isn't it better to just buy another item that can be built into something?

Not necessarily. See, Cull was bought with gold that was given to you for free, that you had to do nothing to earn. Every game, you're going to lane with 0 gold. Cull makes it so you can make a bigger chunk of gold from just farming (Something every ADC does) and then sell the item. It's alot of free gold. All of the gold from 100 CS, plus the 400 from Cull, plus the sellback gold from it. You lose literally nothing from buying it, using it, and then selling it. you actually gain.
Well that's true, but now games are shorter and it is difficult to get the full advantage of the item :s

> [{quoted}](name=Cherysse,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=VkMtZr0E,comment-id=0001000000000000,timestamp=2015-11-17T03:11:12.663+0000)
>
> Well that's true, but now games are shorter and it is difficult to get the full advantage of the item :s

Games are shorter or longer depending on how safely it's played. It isn't the item's fault if the team using it went ham and fed, causing an early game snowball. Tis the consequences of being unsafe
Hmm nope, I don't know if you have seen the patch... Towers are a lot weaker and minions are stronger,

> [{quoted}](name=Cherysse,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=VkMtZr0E,comment-id=000100000000000000000000,timestamp=2015-11-17T03:15:12.525+0000)
>
> Hmm nope, I don't know if you have seen the patch... Towers are a lot weaker and minions are stronger,

Preseason just started. Give it time
{{sticker:zombie-brand-facepalm}} Items are there to be bought, dude
And yet prior to the latest patch, almonst no one bought Rageblade or Frozen Mallet.
Do you buy Deathcap on Kindred?  It's 'there to be bought' after all.

> [{quoted}](name=Lyse,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=VkMtZr0E,comment-id=,timestamp=2015-11-17T02:33:53.385+0000)
>
> Compare this to Dorans Blade
> 
> besides the on hit heal, every stat is weaker: no HP, 3 less AD. Dorans Blade can be kept later because the lifesteal scales with damage and it gives better stats than component items like longsword.
> 
> Now the real benefit seems to be the 300 gold... Still worth!
> but wait! **compared to a completely different item, it does a completely different thing!**

ftfy

The point is that compared to a dorans blade, you'll have 400 more gold.

Cull gets you 400g, not 300. It's 1g per minion extra on top of the 300 once you get the last stack off. It costs 450 and sells for 180. That means the difference between buying it then selling it later is 270. You make 400g off it, so you net a total of 130g extra. Doran's Blade doesn't give you gold and it's 450 that sells for 180. That means Doran's blade, you're in the hole 270 compared to 130g ABOVE. That's a 400g difference. lol.

If you're against an enemy who has a Doran's and you have Cull, if you both have the same CS by 100 CS and you're playing passive, the way you should be with Cull, you end up with 400g over your opponent, no strings attached.
